name: TOWNSHIP OF WHITEHALL, Petitioner, v. AMERICAN CASUALTY COMPANY OF READING, Pennsylvania, Continental Casualty Company, Assurance Company of America and Maryland Casualty Company, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Township of Whitehall v. American Casualty Co. of Reading

parties: TOWNSHIP OF WHITEHALL, Petitioner, v. AMERICAN CASUALTY COMPANY OF READING, Pennsylvania, Continental Casualty Company, Assurance Company of America and Maryland Casualty Company, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 28th day of March, 2002, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is hereby GRANTED. The order of the Superior Court is hereby REVERSED. The case is remanded to the Court of Common Pleas of Lehigh County for further consideration in light of Sunbeam Corp. v. Liberty Mutual Insurance Co., 566 Pa. 494, 781 A.2d 1189 (2001).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
793 A.2d 902
TOWNSHIP OF WHITEHALL, Petitioner, v. AMERICAN CASUALTY COMPANY OF READING, Pennsylvania, Continental Casualty Company, Assurance Company of America and Maryland Casualty Company, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
March 28, 2002.
